title: of the Electoral Act 1992 (No. 23 of 1992) in a manner consistent with sections
heading: 1.1o, 1.2o and 3.2o of Article 16 of the Constitution relating to the conduct of
text_raw:
1.1o, 1.2o and 3.2o of Article 16 of the Constitution relating to the conduct of 
the election to be held consequent upon the Proclamation issued on 14 January 
2020 dissolving Dáil Éireann; 

AND WHEREAS in my opinion it is necessary to make the following order to 
enable the election consequent upon that Proclamation to be duly held in a 
manner consistent with sections 1.1 o, 1.2o and 3.2o of Article 16 of the 
Constitution, subject to compliance with the principles laid down in the 
relevant Acts (within the meaning of section 164 of the Electoral Act 1992) 
taken as a whole: 

NOW I, Eoghan Murphy, Minister for Housing, Planning and Local 
Government, in exercise of the powers conferred on me by section 164 of the 
Electoral Act 1992 (No. 23 of 1992) (as adapted by the Housing, Planning, 
Community and Local Government (Alteration of Name of Department and 
Title of Minister) Order 2017 (S.I. No. 358 of 2017)), hereby order as follows:
text_norm: 1.1o 1.2o 3.2o article 16 constitution relating conduct election held consequent upon proclamation issued 14 january 2020 dissolving dail eireann whereas opinion necessary make following order enable election consequent upon proclamation duly held manner consistent section 1.1 1.2o 3.2o article 16 constitution subject compliance principle laid relevant act (within meaning section 164 electoral act 1992) taken whole eoghan murphy minister housing planning local government exercise power conferred section 164 electoral act 1992 (no 23 1992) (as adapted housing planning community local government (alteration name department title minister) order 2017 (s.i no 358 2017)) hereby order follows

title: of the Electoral Act 1992 (No. 23 of 1992) in a manner consistent with sections
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Electoral Act 1992 (Special Diff iculty)
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Electoral Act 1992 (Special Diff iculty) 

Order 2020.
text_norm: 1 order may cited electoral act 1992 (special diff iculty) order 2020

title: of the Electoral Act 1992 (No. 23 of 1992) in a manner consistent with sections
heading: In this Order-
text_raw:
2. 

In this Order- 

“Act of 1992” means the Electoral Act 1992 (No. 23 of 1992); 

“election to which this Order applies” means the election to be held 
consequent upon the Proclamation issued on 14 January 2020 
dissolving Dáil Éireann.
text_norm: 2 order- act 1992 mean electoral act 1992 (no 23 1992) election order applies mean election held consequent upon proclamation issued 14 january 2020 dissolving dail eireann

title: of the Electoral Act 1992 (No. 23 of 1992) in a manner consistent with sections
heading: 3. Section 62 of the Act of 1992 shall operate in relation to the election to
text_raw:
3. Section 62 of the Act of 1992 shall operate in relation to the election to 
which this Order applies, and shall be deemed always to have operated in 
relation thereto, subject to the modification that in subsection (2), there is 
substituted, and shall be deemed always to have been substituted, the words 
“and ending forty-eight hours after the latest time for receiving nominations” 
for the words “and ending on the commencement of the poll”.
text_norm: 3 section 62 act 1992 shall operate relation election order applies shall deemed always operated relation thereto subject modification subsection (2) substituted shall deemed always substituted word ending forty-eight hour latest time receiving nomination word ending commencement poll

title: of the Electoral Act 1992 (No. 23 of 1992) in a manner consistent with sections
heading: 4. For the avoidance of doubt, and notwithstanding the due performance
text_raw:
4. For the avoidance of doubt, and notwithstanding the due performance 
by a returning officer of his or her functions under section 62(2)(a) or (b) of the 
Act of 1992 prior to the making of this Order, the modification provided for in 
Article 3 has the effect that any notification of the death of a candidate, 
countermand of a poll or public notice given, under either of those paragraphs, 
by the returning officer shall be, and be deemed always to have been, void and 
of no effect. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 7th February, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [34] 3 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

5 February, 2020. 

EOGHAN MURPHY, 

Minister for Housing, Planning and Local Government. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [34]

title: of the Electoral Act 1992 (No. 23 of 1992) in a manner consistent with sections
heading: (This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This Order modifies section 62(2) of the Electoral Act 1992 for the February 
2020 general election, so that a fresh election in a constituency is required only 
in circumstances where a candidate dies during the period beginning forty eight hours before and ending forty-eight hours after the latest time for 
receiving nominations. This Order provides that for the avoidance of doubt, 
and notwithstanding the due performance by a returning officer of his or her 
functions under the Act, any actions taken by a returning officer under section 
62 of the Act prior to the making of this Order, shall be void and of no effect. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [34] 5
